content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Find the result of the latest basketball game between the Miami Heat and the New York Knicks, including the final score and top rebounder from the match.  Please interact with https://www.espn.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To find the latest basketball game result between the Miami Heat and the New York Knicks, I should navigate to the NBA section. There is an "NBA NBA" tab visible in the menu.
Action: Click [17]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To find the latest game result between Miami Heat and New York Knicks, checking the "Scores" section within the NBA area is optimal. This section should list recent games and their results.
Action: Click [11]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current view shows the NBA schedule, not results. To find the latest result for Miami Heat vs. New York Knicks, I need to go to the "Scores" section, which typically lists results of recent games rather than future schedules.
Action: Click [14]
Confidence: 0.99
Completion: 0.35
The action you have chosen cannot be exected. Please double-check if you have selected the wrong Numerical Label or Action or Action format. Then provide the revised Thought and Action.

Thought: The previous action was invalid because the "Scores" tab ([14]) is currently not clickable in this view. Since I'm looking for recent or past results between the Miami Heat and New York Knicks, it's logical to look for "Miami Heat" on the Teams list (menu at the left) to potentially access their schedule/results, as this might lead to specific recent games. The Miami Heat is labeled [33].
Action: Click [33]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.4
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The Miami Heat section opened, but the schedule shows only games for Philadelphia, New York, and other teams—not the Miami Heat or Knicks' recent games. I need to look for a calendar or scores page that may allow me to find past results rather than schedules. "Full Scoreboard »" ([4]) could provide a broader list of results or scores, which should list any recent Miami Heat vs. Knicks game results.
Action: Click [4]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.45
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The NBA Scoreboard page is open, showing upcoming or recent games. There are no Miami Heat or New York Knicks games listed here (only "76ers" vs. "Knicks"). The previous day tabs might help, but the Miami Heat is not here; I need to check previous days. I'll scroll left on the date tabs to see earlier scores in case the latest Heat-Knicks game occurred before Oct 2, 2025.
Action: Click [27]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.5
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: Scrolling to September 29, 2025, shows no games on that date. To find the latest Miami Heat vs. Knicks result, I should continue exploring previous days or consider using the "Calendar" button ([42]) to jump to a specific date or season range, which could be more efficient.
Action: Click [42]
Confidence: 0.9
Completion: 0.55
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar picker is open, and I can select a different month. To find the latest Miami Heat vs. New York Knicks game, it's best to go back to the last NBA season likely before October (as shown here is the 2025 preseason). Selecting a late date in April or May the previous season, when playoffs or regular season ended, would be a good next step. I'll select April 2025 to search for the latest possible regular-season matchup.
Action: Click [38]
Confidence: 0.9
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar is still on September 2025, with no NBA games, indicating the offseason. To find the last Heat vs. Knicks game, I need to go back several months to April or May, typical for the end of the NBA regular season or playoffs. Next, I will continue to use the calendar and select a week or month closer to the NBA playoff period, especially moving to April.
Action: Click [26]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: There are still no NBA games in early September 2025, which confirms this is offseason or preseason. To efficiently find the latest Miami Heat vs. New York Knicks matchup, I need to jump several months back. Using the "Calendar" button should allow direct access to a specific date, likely bringing up a month selection menu for quicker navigation to April or May 2025.
Action: Click [42]
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.65
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar popup is now visible. To efficiently get to the end of the last NBA regular season or the playoffs, I should move the calendar view several months earlier, ideally to April or May 2025, maximizing the chance of seeing the latest Heat vs. Knicks matchup.
Action: Click [24]
Confidence: 0.96
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The calendar view is now on October 2025, still displaying preseason or offseason. I need to keep going back earlier to reach the playoff period or end of the 2024-2025 regular season, which would be in April or May 2025. I should click the left arrow button again to go back another month.
Action: Click [22]
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.72
